attributes.action: Remove the current management board of the National Archives.
attributes.additional_details: The 1921 census, unlike previous ones, which were made available to multiple genealogical companies/organisations, has been sold off to just one, giving them a monopoly of the publicly owned data. This is being exploited by Find My Past who are charging substantial sums to view the data by both their own subscribers and anyone else.
attributes.background: Discharge the current board and replace it with non political members, who know what inclusivity means.

rejection.details: We cannot accept petitions about honours and appointments, which includes requests relating to appointees to the boards of government bodies.
